Uses of Interface
io.permazen.util.CloseableIterator

Packages that use CloseableIterator
Package
Description
io.permazen.kv
byte[] array key/value store API and related utility classes.
io.permazen.kv.array
A simple KVStore implementation based on a sorted array of key/value pairs.
io.permazen.kv.bdb
KVDatabase implementation based on Oracle's Berkeley DB Java Edition.
io.permazen.kv.caching
Caching KVStore and KVDatabase layers.
io.permazen.kv.fdb
KVDatabase implementation based on FoundationDB.
io.permazen.kv.leveldb
KVDatabase implementation based on LevelDB.
io.permazen.kv.lmdb
KVDatabase implementation based on LMDB.
io.permazen.kv.mvcc
Utility classes for MVCC type operations using a KVStore.
io.permazen.kv.mvstore
AtomicKVStore and KVDatabase implementations based on H2 MVStore.
io.permazen.kv.raft
A distributed KVDatabase based on the Raft consensus algorithm.
io.permazen.kv.simple
A simple in-memory implementation of the KVDatabase interface.
io.permazen.kv.spanner
KVDatabase implementation based on Google Cloud Spanner.
io.permazen.kv.sql
KVDatabase implementations based on SQL connections.
io.permazen.kv.util
Utility classes relating to the KVDatabase interface.
io.permazen.kv.xodus
KVDatabase implementation based on Xodus.
io.permazen.util
General utility classes used with Permazen.

  • Uses of CloseableIterator in io.permazen.kv

    Classes in io.permazen.kv that implement CloseableIterator
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    KVPairIterator
    An Iterator that iterates over all key/value pairs in a KVStore within a range of keys, without using the KVStore.getRange() method.
    Methods in io.permazen.kv that return CloseableIterator
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default CloseableIterator<KVPair>
    KVStore.getRange(KeyRange range)
    Iterate the key/value pairs in the specified range in the forward direction.
    default CloseableIterator<KVPair>
    KVStore.getRange(ByteData minKey, ByteData maxKey)
    Iterate the key/value pairs in the specified range in the forward direction.
    CloseableIterator<KVPair>
    KVStore.getRange(ByteData minKey, ByteData maxKey, boolean reverse)
    Iterate the key/value pairs in the specified range.

    Wrap the given plain Iterator as necessary to make it a CloseableIterator.
    static <E> CloseableIterator<E>
    CloseableIterator.wrap(Iterator<E> iterator, AutoCloseable resource)
    Wrap the given plain Iterator to make it a CloseableIterator, such that when close() is invoked, the associated resource is closed.
